title: The One With The Sonogram at the End

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What you guys don't understand is, for us, kissing is as important as any part of it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, right!.......Y'serious?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Everything you need to know is in that first kiss.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Absolutely.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act, y'know? I mean it's like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd comes out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, and-and it's not that we don't like the comedian, it's that-that... that's not why we bought the ticket.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The problem is, though, after the concert's over, no matter how great the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y'know? I mean, we're in the car, we're fighting traffic... basically just trying to stay awake.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well,

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: WORD OF ADVICE Bring back the comedian. Otherwise next time you're gonna find yourself sitting at home, listening to that album alone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (pause)....Are we still talking about sex?

events.event_description: Monica explains that kissing is important for women
Chandler compares kissing to an opening act before a concert
Rachel advises the men to bring back the comedian or listen to the album alone
Joey asks if they are still talking about sex

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-worker (Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, it's good, it is good, it's just that- mm- doesn't she seem a little angry?

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: Well, she has issues.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Does she.

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: He's out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like 'Gee, that glacier's getting kinda close.' See?

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (trying to ignore her) No. No.

dialogue.speaker: MARSHA
dialogue.text: Yes, it is. Carol! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, yes, it is. (waves) How about I'll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: So.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You look great. I, uh... I hate that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Sorry. You look good too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, well, in here, anyone who... stands erect... So what's new? Still, uh...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: A lesbian?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well... you never know. How's, um.. how's the family?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Marty's still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why- why are you here, Carol?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pregnant?!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Museum of Prehistoric History, Ross and a co-worker (Marsha) are setting up an exhibit which includes some mannequins of cave people.]

events.event_description: Ross and Marsha discuss the angry expression of a cave woman mannequin
Marsha points out that Ross's ex-wife Carol has arrived
Ross greets Carol and they exchange awkward pleasantries
Carol reveals to Ross that she is pregnant

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are watching Three's Company.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I think this is the episode of Three's Company where there's some kind of misunderstanding.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ...Then I've already seen this one! (Turns off the TV.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (taking a drink from Joey) Are you through with that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Whose little ball of paper is this?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn't need it, so I balled it up and... (sees that Monica is glaring at him) ...now I wish I was dead.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (She lifts up the cushion of the couch and it's all dirty and gross under it) Eww!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, I'm sorry guys, I just don't wanna give them any more ammunition than they already have.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a child's pillow.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, Hi! Um, Monica, you're scaring me. I mean, you're like all chaotic and twirly, you know? And not-not in a good way.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, calm down. You don't see Ross getting all chaotic and twirly every time they come.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong. You see, he's the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (Looking out the window) Uh, Mudda? Ross is here. (Turns away from the window.) I'd like to say that I can't do this, but I think I just did.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Entering) Hi. (They all say hi back)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's with you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I just feel like someone reached down my throat, grabbed my small intestine, pulled it out of my mouth and tied it around my neck.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Cookie?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Carol moved her stuff out today.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ohh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let me get you some coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (To all) Thanks. (To Monica) No, no don't! Stop cleansing! See, everything doesn't have to be pristine. You know what? I'll just get the coffee myself.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, is this decaf? Where's the real coffee?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I gotta get some.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (About to drink the coffee) So, uh, how's it going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Drinks the coffee) How's it going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Good. So, uh, do you think there's a chance we'll get to see this sometime soon?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What're you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's your birthday. You know, the big day. Where you have the cake and presents and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (He turns and enters his bedroom, Carol is putting on her coat.) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I just wanted to say goodbye.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: This is really hard for me too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, I know. I mean, I just wasn't expecting this.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I'm not, I'm not blaming you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know what to say to that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Nothing. I mean, I'm not saying that you should say anything. I'm, I'm just saying, you know, I'm-I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah, I'm sorry too. (They hug)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Entering) So she's gone. Off to be with her lesbian lover. Oh, God, that hurt more than I thought it would.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know. Oh, c'mere.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, no no no... don't. Stop cleansing, okay? Just let me handle this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Starts to run to the bathroom to cry, sees parents, stops, walks to parents) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, this is Carol.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Carol, this is my mother and father.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, good. Great. Well, I'm gonna go get some coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oops, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Listen, do you maybe wanna talk about this?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, I'm gonna get a refill. Anybody else? (They all say no) No? Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So uh, what're you gonna do now?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know. What do you do when you break up with the only person you've ever loved?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, I know, I know! They have a ball of paper! It's like rock, paper, scissors! Okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You don't understand.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, I really don't.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You know what the scariest part is? What if there's only one woman for everybody, y'know? I mean what if you get one woman, and that's it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Then you just have to... carry on and... live your life. Sucks, doesn't it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My ex-wife is a lesbian.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Great. Mine never even got that far.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are watching Three's Company.]

events.event_description: Chandler jokes about Three's Company having a misunderstanding
Monica gets angry about a ball of paper on the floor
Ross enters and announces that Carol is pregnant
The group reacts with shock and confusion to Ross's news

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's OB/GYN, they're still arguing about what to name the baby.]

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, please! What's wrong with Helen?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Helen Geller? I don't think so.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hello? It's not gonna be Helen Geller.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: No, I mean it's not Geller.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, it's gonna be Helen Willick?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: No, actually, um, we talked about Helen Willick-Bunch.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, wait a minute, wha- why is she in the title?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: It's my baby too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, 's'funny, really? Um, I don't remember you making any sperm.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, and we all know what a challenge that is!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: All right, you two, stop it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no no, she gets a credit, hey, I'm in there too.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ross. You're not actually suggesting Helen Willick-Bunch-Geller? 'Cause I think that borders on child abuse.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Of course not, I'm... suggesting Geller-Willick-Bunch.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, no, nonononono, you see what he's doing? He knows no-one's gonna say all those names, so they'll wind up calling her Geller, then he gets his way!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My way?! You-you think this is my way? Believe me, of all the ways I ever imagined this moment in my life being, this is not my way- y'know what? Uh, um, this is too hard. I'm not, I can't do-

dialogue.speaker: DR. OBERMAN
dialogue.text: (entering) Knock knock!How are we today? Any nausea?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah. A little.

dialogue.speaker: DR. OBERMAN
dialogue.text: Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks for sharing. (To Carol) Uh, lie back..

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You- uh- y'know what, I'm gonna go. I don't- I don't think I can be involved in this particular thing right now.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Look at that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I know.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Carol's OB/GYN, they're still arguing about what to name the baby.]

events.event_description: Susan suggests naming the baby Helen
Ross objects to the name Helen Geller
Carol reveals the baby will not have the Geller surname
Ross and Susan argue about whose surname should come first
Dr. Oberman enters and begins the sonogram examination
Ross sees the baby on the sonogram screen and is amazed

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment, everyone is watching the tape of the sonogram. Rachel is on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well? Isn't that amazing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are we supposed to be seeing here?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I dunno, but.. I think it's about to attack the Enterprise.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know, if you tilt your head to the left, and relax your eyes, it kinda looks like an old potato.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Then don't do that, alright?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (walks over to where Monica is standing)Monica. Whaddya think?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (welling up) Mm-hmm.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wh- are you welling up?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You are, you're welling up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Am not!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're gonna be an aunt.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pushes him and starts to cry) Oh shut up!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it's Rachel. Yeah, I'm fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it's okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y'know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. (Slams the phone down.) (To everyone) Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment, everyone is watching the tape of the sonogram. Rachel is on the phone.]

events.event_description: Ross shows the sonogram video to his friends
Chandler and Phoebe make jokes about what the sonogram looks like
Ross notices that Monica is welling up with emotion
Rachel calls Mindy and makes a sarcastic comment about her and Barry
